Block Calls application does not collect any kind of information including personal identification information, period.\n\nBlock Calls application does not establish any network connection to Internet in any way. Because of that, there is neither banner advertisements nor mobile analytics.
Block Calls application is distributed through Google Play Store. Google may provide information about you in certain circumstances; for example, reports to diagnose and fix Block Calls issues.

This privacy policy may be amended or updated. A notice will be provided of amendments to this privacy policy, as appropriate. Your continued use of Block Calls application confirms your acceptance of this privacy policy, as amended. If you do not agree to this privacy policy, as amended, you must stop using Block Calls application.

Block Calls application is offered to you, the user, conditioned upon your acceptance of all of the terms, conditions, policies and notices stated here. We reserve the right to make changes to these Terms and Conditions immediately by posting the changed Terms and Conditions in this location.

Your continued use of the Block Calls application constitutes your agreement to all such terms, conditions and notices, and any changes to the Terms and Conditions made by us.

The term ‘Block Calls’ or ‘us’ or ‘we’ refers to the owner of the application. The term ‘you’ refers to the user of Block Calls application.

The use of this application is subject to the following terms of use: Use the application at your own risk. This application is provided to you “as is,” without warranty of any kind either express or implied. Block Calls application will not be accurate, reliable, uninterrupted or error-free. No agent or representative has the authority to create any warranty regarding the application on behalf of Block Calls application. Block Calls application reserves the right to change or discontinue at any time any aspect or feature of the application.

Neither we nor any third parties provide any warranty or guarantee as to the accuracy, timeliness, performance, completeness or suitability of the functionality found or offered on this application for any particular purpose. You acknowledge that such functionality may contain inaccuracies or errors and we expressly exclude liability for any such inaccuracies or errors to the fullest extent permitted by law.

Your use of any functionality on this application is entirely at your own risk, for which we shall not be liable. It shall be your own responsibility to ensure that any functionality, services or information available through this application meet your specific requirements.
Add a number to the blacklist
This tutorial will guide you through the basic functionality to block unwanted calls.
The blacklist is simply a list of phone numbers you want to block. When you receive a phone call, which number is registered in the blacklist, the app hangs up the call immediately.
Tap the + button and choose any of the 3 options. When you finish, you will see the new number in the blacklist.
The next time you are called from a blacklisted number, the app will block the call and the @ icon will appear in the notification bar. That way you\'ll know that a call was blocked by the app.
You will find more blocking options in this icon. For example, block all private calls or only allow calls that are registered to your contacts.
Blacklist is empty.\n Tap the + button to add a phone number.
Please, allow <font color="#ffd740">%s</font> into <font color="#ffd740">Protected Apps</font> to keep running after the screen is turned off.
All blocked calls in the log will be deleted.
All numbers in the blacklist will be deleted! This can\'t be undone.
